Box 309522 Alabama Board of Funeral Service State Funeral Service Boards and Licensing Requirements As of April 5, 2011 The information on this page is subject to change without notice; students should contact their state board for specific requirements. The International Conference of Funeral Service Examining Boards administers national and state board exams. See below for state-specific information. International Conference of Funeral Service Examining Boards 1885 Shelby Lane Fayetteville, AR 72704-5265 Phone: 479-442-7076 Fax: 479-442-7090 Website: www.cfseb.org Email: info@theconferenceonline.org Licensing Boards and Requirements } document.writeln(''); document.writeln(' '); if ( !document.getElementById('overDiv') ) {
textAfterTable: Alaska Div. of Occupational Licensing Mortuary Science Section PO Box 110806 J Juneau, AK 99811-0806 Phone: 907-465-2550 Fax: 907-465-2974 Email: license@alaska.gov  Web: http://commerce.alaska.gov/dnn/cbpl/ProfessionalLicensing/Morticians.aspx Type of License Educational Requirements Continuing Education Requirements Apprenticeship Embalmer Graduation from an accredited mortuary college No CE requirements 1 year under licensed embalmer Funeral Director 30 semester hours from a college or university No CE requirements 1 year under funeral director licensed in Alaska   Arizona State Board of Funeral Directors and Embalmers 1400 W. Washington, Ste 230 Phoenix, AZ 85007 Phone: 602-542-8152 Fax: 602-542-3093 Email: rudy.thomas@azfuneralboard.us Web: https://funeralboard.az.gov Type of License Educational Requirements Continuing Education Requirements Apprenticeship Embalmer High school and mortuary college; pass national exam 12 hours per year 1 year after school Funeral Director High school and mortuary college; one year embalmer licensure and experience; pass national board exam 12 hours per year 1 year after school   Arkansas State Board of Embalmers & Funeral Directors Department
